intro: Potentilla indiges, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has finely divided, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy species adapted to harsh climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
